title: Addition Property
text: The addition property states that if $$a<b$$, then $$a+c<b+c$$.
speech: The addition property states that if  a is less than, b , then  a, plus c, is less than b plus c .
pacedSpeech: The addition property states that if   a is less than, b
, then   a, plus c, is less than b plus c

title: Addition Property
text: What number should we add on both sides in order to isolate the variable with its coefficient on the left?

title: Multiplication Property
text: The multiplication property states that if $$a<b$$ and $$c>0$$, then $$ac<bc$$.
speech: The multiplication property states that if  a is less than b  and  c, is greater than 0 , then  a c, is less than b c .
pacedSpeech: The multiplication property states that if   a is less than b
, then   a c, is less than b c

title: Multiplication Property
text: What number should we multiply on both sides in order to isolate the variable by itself on the left?
speech: What number should we multiply on both sides in order to isolate the variable by itself on the left?

title: Multiplication Property
text: What do we get when we multiply $$\frac{1}{3}$$ on both sides?
